Title: 'Top Gun: Maverick' surpasses 'Avengers: Infinity war' to become the 6th highest grossing film
Narrative:
"Top Gun: Maverick" has collected $679 million in North America, enough to overtake "Avengers: Infinity War". It's the sixth-highest grossing movie in domestic box office history. 2018's every-hero-but-the-kitchen-sink adventure "Infinity War" had a little help in building up anticipation. "Maverick" had Tom Cruise, a box office hero in his own right, but moviegoers hadn't felt the need for speed in 30 years.

Yet, thanks to stellar word-of-mouth and repeat customers, "Maverick" continues to defy the odds.  That's without playing in China or Russia, two major overseas markets. Can the "Top Gun" follow-up take down 2018's blockbuster "Black Panther" and its $700.4 million tally to crack the top five domestic grossers of all-time? It'll be fairly desolate at the box office until November, when "Black Panther: Wakanda Forever" opens in theaters. 

"Top Gun: Maverick" is Cruise's first movie to reach $100 million in a single weekend. Joseph Kosinski directed the film, which picks up decades after the original Top Gun film. Miles Teller, Glen Powell, Jon Hamm, Jennifer Connelly and Val Kilmer all star.
